title: (x) Tart clothing line logo simple sans - various similar {gang}
content:
Hi I need help identifying the font used for the TART clothing line logo. I have found fonts very similar but not the exact one. I have attached an image....

Thanks  
Anna

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [tart logosm.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20110209170353/http:/typophile.com/files/tart%20logosm.jpg) | 14.09 KB |
author: annainla

comments.content: I am willing to bet you'll never find a font that matches. This appears to be a custom made logo.

I think you might be right...I found a close match with Kylemont or maurea-thin on WhatTheFont but not exact...they want a poster with just the logo on but do not have the font...

Thanks

Those simple lines should be rather easy to trace in a drawing program. I found the shape of the P in [Century Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20110209170353/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/century-gothic/) to be fairly close, but the A was a bit too wide, and the stroke was also a bit thicker in the regular weight. (Adding a leg to the P to make your R would be easy)

- Mike Yanega

The overall construction of [Engravers Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20110209170353/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/engravers-gothic/engravers-gothic/) or [Sackers Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20110209170353/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/sackers-gothic/) is similar, although the details don't match.
Thankyou for your help! I will see about adjusting the above fonts to find a close match.
